alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:43AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARION AND WEST CENTRAL PUTNAM COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM EDT... At 243 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Fort McCoy, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Interlachen, Fort McCoy, Orange Springs, Hog Valley, and Johnson. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.
